page.title: 06FARMING: DEER.
page.content: The deer farm at Beecraigs country park was started in the mid seventies. It covers a large area of ground that was used for rough grazing at one time. The deer in the park are from the native Red deer.The herd has grown from six calves into a herd of about a hundred hinds and the stags. There are two full time workers at the farm. Mr Dickson is the ranger in charge and his assistant is a youth employed through the Youth Training Scheme. At busy times of the year other casual labour is employed. The public is able to watch the deer from a specially built walkway through the deer paddock,there are also viewing platforms. The venison is sold to the public and to hotels.
